content.title: QED Scale Hierarchy: From Classical to Planck
content.summary: A comprehensive comparison of the characteristic length scales in quantum electrodynamics, from the classical electron radius to the Planck length, showing how different physics dominates at each scale.

scale_hierarchy.name: Planck Length
scale_hierarchy.physics_description: Quantum gravity regime. Spacetime may be discrete. All known physics breaks down.

scale_hierarchy.name: GUT Scale
scale_hierarchy.physics_description: Grand unification of strong and electroweak forces
scale_hierarchy.experimental_status: Probed indirectly via proton decay limits

scale_hierarchy.name: Electroweak Scale
scale_hierarchy.physics_description: Electroweak unification. W/Z bosons, Higgs mechanism.

scale_hierarchy.name: Classical Electron Radius
scale_hierarchy.physics_description: Classical estimate of electron size. QED becomes strongly coupled.

scale_hierarchy.name: Compton Wavelength (electron)
scale_hierarchy.physics_description: Pair production becomes possible. Particle localization limit.

scale_hierarchy.name: Bohr Radius
scale_hierarchy.physics_description: Atomic scale. Non-relativistic quantum mechanics sufficient.

key_ratios.interpretation: Atomic physics is 24 orders of magnitude removed from quantum gravity
Bohr radius is larger than Compton wavelength by fine-structure constant inverse
Compton wavelength is larger than classical radius by same factor
Atomic scale to classical electron radius spans two powers of α

fine_structure_constant_role.description: The fine-structure constant α ≈ 1/137 governs the ratios between QED scales
relationships: r_e = α²a₀ (classical radius from Bohr radius)
λ̄_C = αa₀ (Compton wavelength from Bohr radius)
r_e = αλ̄_C (classical radius from Compton wavelength)
fine_structure_constant_role.interpretation: The hierarchy of QED scales is set by powers of α. Because α << 1, there is a clear separation of scales allowing perturbation theory.

planck_connection.description: All QED scales can be expressed in terms of Planck length and mass ratios
planck_connection.key_insight: The enormous ratio m_P/m_e ≈ 2.4×10²² is why atomic physics is so far from Planck scale

primary_sources.author: Weinberg
primary_sources.title: The Quantum Theory of Fields, Vol. 1
